text: Lynne Ewing is an American author. While growing up, she and her two sisters moved a lot as her father was in the Marine Corps. Lynne graduated high school in Lima, Peru after attending seven other schools. While living in Peru, she learned to speak Spanish. She attended the University of California at Santa Barbara. She was 30 years old when she began writing for newspapers, documentaries, magazines, and did screen writing. She was also a counselor. Her first books were Drive-By and Party Girl. Drive-By took six years to write, and Party Girl was made into a movie called Living the Life. She wrote the Daughters of the Moon, Sisters of Isis, and Sons of the Dark series. == Books == * Drive By - Written in 1996 * Party Girl - Written in 1999 * Daughters of the Moon - Written from 2000-2007 * Sons of the Dark - Written from 2004-2005 * Sisters of Isis - 2007-2008 She is still writing the book In 2001, Lynne's book Party Girl became a movie called Living the Life; Lynne was one of two screenwriters.
